item.content:
[!info]+ Important

MyEasyAgent is more than a business; it’s a mission to bridge the gap between the “average Nigerian” and their right to a home. In a market like Lagos, where “Who you know” often outweighs “What you pay,” our platform prioritizes performance over deep pockets. This blueprint defines the “What,” “Why,” and “How” of our journey.

1. Execution Summary

MyEasyAgent is a trust-centric PropTech ecosystem designed specifically for the Nigerian market. Unlike traditional listing sites that prioritize paid visibility, we utilize a Performance-Based Ranking system and a Usage-Based Monetization model.

  • Problem Statement: We aim to solve the twin crises of fraud and exploitative “Agency Fees.”

  • Solution: A regulated commitment fee system (₦2,500) and verified property intelligence.

  • Mission: To democratize access to affordable housing in Nigeria through transparent, tech-enabled connections.

  • Vision: To be the primary infrastructure for trust in Nigerian Real Estate, eliminating the fear of exploitation.

2. Business Model & Strategy

2.1 Revenue Model

Our revenue is built on three distinct pillars to ensure sustainability and align with user success.

  1. Unit Economics:

    • HuntSmart Pass (Primary): A ₦15,000 usage-based pass. Includes 1 complimentary inspection and 4 additional prioritized slots (subject to the ₦2,500 commitment fee).

    • Commitment Fees: ₦2,500 per inspection.

      • Platform Share: ₦500 (Covers operational overhead and verification).

      • Agent Share: ₦2,000 (Incentivizes attendance and covers transport).

  2. Commission Split (Performance Fees):

    • Direct Deals: 50/50 split between the agent and the platform.

    • Sub-Direct Deals: 50/25/25 split (Direct Agent / Sub-Direct Agent / Platform).

  3. Scalability Plan: The usage-based model avoids “subscription fatigue,” allowing users to pay only when they are actively hunting for a home.

2.2 Market Positioning

We move away from being a “Listing Directory” to becoming a Trust Infrastructure & Matchmaker.

  • The Problem with Traditional Sites: Platforms like PropertyPro.ng or Nigeria Property Centre operate on “Pay-to-Play” subscription models. They provide leads but do not guarantee results or safety.

  • The MyEasyAgent Core Positioning Statement: For the average Nigerian and hustling family in Lagos who are tired of ‘ghost’ listings and exploitative agency fees, MyEasyAgent is the performance-based connector that guarantees verified property access. Unlike traditional sites that rank agents by how much they pay, we rank agents by how much they deliver.

  • Solving Transaction Leakage: Traditional sites lose revenue when agents move deals offline (“Sidelining”). We prevent this via the Digital Handshake (QR Check-in) at the property, tracking the deal from inspection to closing.

3. Competitive Landscape

3.1 Competitor Comparison Table

Feature PropertyPro.ng Land.ng Expertlisting.ng MyEasyAgent.com
Business Model Subscription-based Freemium + Legal services Transparency & Data-driven Usage-based (HuntSmart)
Agent Ranking Pay-to-Play Listing-based Data-based Performance-based
Trust Factor Low (Ghost listings) Moderate (Land titles) High (Flood/Price data) High (TrustShield & QR), Flood and Price data
Audience Everyone (Luxury focus) Buyers/Developers Data-conscious seekers Average Nigerians, and Data-Conscious seekers
Incentive Lead Generation Secure Documentation No Middlemen Affordability & Access
Revenue Source Monthly Subscriptions Ad packages Data Intel Success Fees & Splits, and Data Intel
Transaction Cut 0% 0% 0% 25% to 50%
Platform Risk Zero Risk Low Risk Low Risk Shared Risk/High Reward

[!tip] Tips

  • The “Flood-Proof” Filter: Integrating flood-data tags to address a major Lagos pain point.
  • The “Agent Identity” Tier: Differentiating between “Verified Key-Holders” (Direct access) and “Property Scouts” (Semi-direct) to show the user the length of the chain.

4. Risk Assessment: The “Bad Sides”

Despite our safeguards, we must navigate these inherent Lagos market risks:

  1. Agent Resistance: A 25–50% commission split is a massive jump from the 0% charged by competitors.

  2. Sidelining Vulnerability: High incentives for agents to “hide” the deal to save the commission cut.

  3. Scaling Bottlenecks: Manual “HomeView” inspections are slow and costly.

  4. Market Speed vs. Process: Lagos rentals move in hours; our legal review/offer process might be perceived as a delay.

  5. Legal Limits: Our Provisional Offer is not a Tenancy Agreement; we still rely on client due diligence.

  6. Upfront Fee Psychology: Overcoming the barrier of users expecting “Free Browsing.”

5. Strategic Solutions & Success Probabilities

5.1 Success Probability (Risk-Weighted)

  • Financial Sustainability: 70% (Steady cash flow from HuntSmart Pass/Commitment fees).

  • Trust & Adoption: 55% (High value vs. psychological barrier of upfront fees).

  • Sidelining Prevention: 40% (The most difficult area; requires strong digital “locks”).

5.2 The Solution Set

  • Leakage Prevention: Use the “Legal Review Lock”, clients are warned that paying without our “Safe to Sign” certificate voids all platform protections.

  • Scaling through “Graduated Trust”: Use the HomeView Badge for team-verified properties and Incentivized Video Walkthroughs for agent-verified (Standard) listings.

  • The “Remote Handover” Script: Allow Semi-Direct agents to stay home while the Direct Agent takes the ₦2,000 transport fee, protecting everyone’s split.

  • Fast Market Fix: Implement Instant Digital Receipts. The moment a client clicks “I Want This House,” an offer letter is generated and the agent is notified immediately via WhatsApp.

6. HomeView Audit & Checklist

[!danger] Danger

Do not launch the website until you have at least 20 properties that have gone through the “HomeView” process. Devaluing the HuntSmart Pass by launching an empty shell will destroy our brand.

6.1 The Professional Property Audit Checklist

1. Exterior & Structural:

  • Check for structural cracks, roof leaks (water stains), and drainage/flood history.

  • Security features (fence height, gate condition).

2. Utilities & Services:

  • Water: Test pump, check for “Iron Water,” and tank availability.

  • Electricity: Confirm Prepaid vs. Estimated billing; test all sockets.

  • Waste: Verify PSP collection points.

3. Interior Audit:

  • Check for hollow tiles and ventilation quality.

  • Inspect cabinetry for termites (wood-borers) or dampness.

  • Plumbing: Flush all toilets; check soakaway proximity to water sources.

4. Neighborhood Context:

  • Road accessibility during rain and proximity to noise sources (churches/bars).

  • Estimated commute times and mobile network strength (MTN/Airtel/Starlink).

[!info] info HomeView is the core value proposition of the HuntSmart Pass, the checklist must be exhaustive. It transforms a simple “house viewing” into a professional Property Audit.

7. Organizational Structure

7.1 Governance Framework

  • Model: High-Accountability / Domain-Authority.

  • Equity: 40%/60% split among 3 co-founders.

  • Vesting: 4-year schedule with a 1-year cliff.

7.2 Roles & Responsibilities (Co-founder Matrix)

1. Emmanuel — Chief Executive Officer (CEO) & Head of Product

Mission: To protect the long-term sustainability and unit economics of the platform.

  • Core Responsibilities:

    • Monetization Strategy: Final authority on the pricing of the HuntSmart Pass and the percentage splits (50/50, 50/25/25).

    • Unit Economics: Monitoring the “Platform Drain”—ensuring the ₦500 platform fee from the commitment fee covers SMS, server, and administrative costs.

    • Investor & Legal Relations: Sourcing institutional partnerships (Banks/Insurance) for the “Legal Review” and “Rent Financing” phases.

    • The “Build Once” Philosophy: Reviewing all features to ensure they are automated and don’t require manual human labor at scale.

  • System Ownership: The Admin Dashboard, Revenue Reporting, and Strategic Roadmap.

  • Success Metric (KPI): Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) and Platform Profitability.

2. Arinze — Chief Technology Officer (CTO) & Lead Developer

Mission: To build the “Trust Engine” that automates agent payouts and client security.

  • Core Responsibilities:

    • Full-Stack Architecture: Managing the entire codebase, ensuring the “Mobile-First” PWA (Progressive Web App) experience is seamless.

    • Automation Logic: Developing the QR Code/Unique Booking ID system that triggers the ₦1,500 payout to agents without manual admin intervention.

    • Security & Scale: Integrating Paystack/Flutterwave and ensuring 99.9% uptime.

    • Currency Check System: Building the automated 48-72 hour “Nudge” system that removes expired listings.

  • System Ownership: Backend database, Payment APIs, and the Agent/Client User Interface.

  • Success Metric (KPI): System Uptime and Successful Automation Rate (payouts with zero manual errors).

3. Precious — Chief Customer Officer (CCO) & Head of Field Ops

Mission: To ensure that “Verified” actually means “Truthful” and to professionalize the agents.

  • Core Responsibilities:

    • TrustShield Operations: Physical and digital verification of LASRERA/ERCAAN certificates for every agent.

    • HomeView Management: Scheduling and executing the physical audits (The Checklist) to create the Truth Reports for HuntSmart users.

    • Agent Discipline: Enforcing the “Indictment & Punishment” rules. If an agent lies about a property, Precious is the one who suspends them.

    • Dispute Resolution: Handling “No-Show” tickets when a client pays ₦2,000 but the agent is unavailable.

  • System Ownership: Agent Onboarding Workflow, HomeView Checklists, and Customer Support.

  • Success Metric (KPI): Agent Integrity Score and User Trust (measured by CSAT).

4. Samson — Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) & Communications Lead

Mission: To simplify the “Why” and educate the market on paying upfront for trust.

  • Core Responsibilities:

    • Educational Marketing: Creating content that explains why the ₦15,000 HuntSmart Pass is cheaper than traditional “Lagos Form Fees.”

    • Legal-to-Simple Copy: Translating the “Provisional Offer & Acceptance Form” and “Legal Review” into language a regular tenant understands and trusts.

    • Lead Acquisition: Driving serious home-seekers (not window shoppers) to the platform through targeted Lagos-centric social media campaigns.

    • Brand Authority: Ensuring MyEasyAgent is positioned as the “Bank of Trust” in real estate.

  • System Ownership: All Social Media Channels, Content Strategy, and the Onboarding Educational Loop.

  • Success Metric (KPI): Cost Per Acquired User (CAC) and “HuntSmart” conversion rate.

7.3 The RACI Matrix

R = Responsible (Doer) | A = Accountable (Owner/Sign-off) | C = Consulted | I = Informed

Key Process Emmanuel Arinze Precious Samson
New Property Validation C I A R
HomeView Audit I I R/A C
Automated Payout (₦1,500) A R I I
Closing 50/50 Deal R/A I C C
Agent Suspension A I R I

7.4 Decision-Making & Conflict Resolution

  • Expert Domain Rule: Arinze and Emmanuel have the tie-breaking vote for Technology. Samson holds the vote for Marketing. Precious holds the vote for Agent Operations.

  • CEO Veto: Emmanuel holds final veto power for financial or survival matters (requires written justification).

  • Truth First: No decision can compromise the “Trust Infrastructure” for clicks.

8. Key Milestones (Q1 – Q4)

These milestones focus on a “Revenue First, Scale Second” approach to ensure Phase 1 brings in value immediately.

Q1: The Validation Phase (The “Zero-to-One” Launch)

  • Technical: Deploy MVP with mandatory email verification, Launch HuntSmart Pass + HomeView + ₦2,000 commitment fee in one high-demand neighborhood. Target: 100% accuracy on reports

  • Operational: Onboard first 20-50 LASRERA/ERCAAN-certified agents in a specific Lagos cluster (e.g., Amuwo or Satlite).

  • Revenue: Secure the first 50 HuntSmart Pass (₦15,000) sales and 100 successful Commitment Fee (₦2,000) transactions.

  • Goal: Prove that the “Commitment Fee Logic” reduces client and agent no-shows.

Q2: The Trust-Deepening Phase (Physical vs. Digital)

  • System: Automate the 48-72 Hour Currency Check—if an agent doesn’t confirm availability via email/SMS nudge, the property status shifts to #AwaitingUpdate.

  • Goal: Increase platform reliability and reduce “Ghost Listings.”

Q3: The Anti-Sidelining Phase (Transaction Security)

  • Feature: Launch the digital Provisional Tenancy Offer & Acceptance Form and the Free Legal Review service.

  • Strategy: Aggressively market the “Legal Review Lock” to prevent users from paying landlords/agents off-platform.

  • Revenue: Track first 10 successful Commission Splits (50/50 or 50/25/25) on closed deals.

  • Goal: Capture the “Big Money” at the end of the funnel.

Q4: The Expansion & Scale Phase

  • Technical: Upgrade the Booking ID system to a full QR Code Check-in and automated payout dashboard.

  • Market: Expand from the initial cluster to cover 80% of Lagos mainland and island.

  • Governance: Review the 4-year vesting performance; hire the first Customer Care/Operations team to offload Precious and Samson.

  • Goal: Reach a 62%+ Success Rate across all system pillars (Financial, Trust, and Sidelining).

9. UX & Founder Refinement

  • 9.1 Website Testing & Development Issues:

    This document outlines the major challenges and required improvements identified during testing. All team members are expected to read and understand these points to ensure proper implementation and quality control.

  1. User Registration & Email Verification

    When users sign up with email/ Google mail as:

    • Agents - looking to list properties.
    • Clients - looking to rent properties/ Scanning the website.
    • Landlords - looking to list properties.

After registration, users should see a popup or banner notification requesting them to:

  • Check their email for confirmation.
  • verify their account.

After verification, users should be redirected back to the platform, they can either:

  • Complete their profile.
  • Scan through the website for what they want.
  1. Agent/Landlord Hero Page:

Agents should have a dynamic hero page, for mobile and desktop and displays the following:

  • Home
  • Notification
  • Manage your listings (Dashboard) - Agent.
  • My Watchlist
  • Profile
  • Share feedback
  • Sign Out.

Agents should have a profile page that is simple to navigate and allows them to:

  • Fill their personal details after sign in.
  • Upload required data
  • Change password
  • Add phone number
  • Add profile picture
  • Change email address

Agents should have a minimalist and easy-to-use dashboard that allows them to:

  • Set available days and times for inspections.

  • Allow clients to book inspections based on availability.

  • Add Property details such as

  • Edit or cancel inspection schedules.

  • Manage individual inspections for each property.

  • Adjust schedules based on landlord availability.

  1. Client Hero Page:

item.title: What Can We Remove?
item.description:
In 2021, the noise got too loud. My screen was filled with other people’s highlights, and i felt behind.
I was tired, anxious, and scrolling through a life that wasn’t mine.

So I started to quietly unfollow. I kept only what built me up. The noise faded. My mind cleared. I could breathe again.

We often treat our lives and our businesses like our social feeds.

We add and add. More features. More steps. More rules. Interdependencies proliferate, and gradually strangle us. We think more means better. But really, more often means more clutter.
item.content:
In 2021, the noise got too loud. My screen was filled with other people’s highlights, and i felt behind.
I was tired, anxious, and scrolling through a life that wasn’t mine.

So I started to quietly unfollow. I kept only what built me up. The noise faded. My mind cleared. I could breathe again.

We often treat our lives and our businesses like our social feeds.

We add and add. More features. More steps. More rules. Interdependencies proliferate, and gradually strangle us. We think more means better. But really, more often means more clutter.

While building my startup, i remembered that feeling of digital weight. I didn’t want to create another crowded space. Another beach full of trash no one cleans.

So i am building with the same intention:

  • Remove before you add.
  • Simplify before you complicate.
  • Care for the space so others can breathe in it.

This is the unseen art of pruning. It’s not about having less. It’s about making room for what matters.

When you come here, i want you to feel something rare online: Calm, Clarity, Space. No hidden traps. No fake listings. No stress. Just clean homes and clear steps.

I am building this for the version of me that was tired of the noise. For the person who just wants a home, not a headache. A good system is designed to be periodically cleared of cruft. It has a built-in counterbalance. Without this pressure, our bias drives us to add band-aid after band-aid, until the only choice is to destroy the whole system and start from scratch.

So here’s my quiet invitation to you:

Look at your feed today. What’s one thing you can let go of? One old rule you can delete? One expectation you can release?

You don’t have to build a castle to matter. Sometimes the most sacred work is sweeping the sand so others can walk barefoot and feel the earth.
